Berlin Restores Power After Five-Day Blackout
(
According to a news agency, citing grid operator Stromnetz Berlin, electricity is expected to return to all affected homes within hours after a temporary cable installation was successfully tested overnight.
The outage began early Saturday when cables leading to a power station were deliberately set on fire, cutting power to about 45,000 households and more than 2,200 businesses. This incident triggered Berlin’s longest blackout since World War II.
A group calling itself Vulkangruppe (Volcano Group) claimed responsibility in an online statement on Sunday, declaring it had "successfully sabotaged" infrastructure connected to a gas power station in Lichterfelde.
Berlin’s mayor, Kai Wegner, condemned the act as "a terrorist act" during a press briefing on Tuesday. He stressed: "We have experienced a terrorist attack in this city. A left-wing terrorist attack. I want to reiterate: This was not a minor arson attack, nor was it sabotage. This was a terrorist act."
Germany’s Federal Prosecutor’s Office has launched an investigation on terrorism-related grounds, the news agency reported on Tuesday. Authorities suspect crimes including membership in a terrorist organization, unconstitutional sabotage, arson, and disruption of public services.
MENAFN) German media reported Wednesday that electricity in southwestern Berlin has been progressively reinstated following an assault on power lines that left tens of thousands of households in the snow-covered capital without supply for five days.According to a news agency, citing grid operator Stromnetz Berlin, electricity is expected to return to all affected homes within hours after a temporary cable installation was successfully tested overnight.
The outage began early Saturday when cables leading to a power station were deliberately set on fire, cutting power to about 45,000 households and more than 2,200 businesses. This incident triggered Berlin’s longest blackout since World War II.

I want to reiterate: This was not a minor arson attack, nor was it sabotage. This was a terrorist act."
